subject: Re: MiniBox - General Recommendations
author: Lance Oliver
full_text:
Hi Ann,

Sure enough. That's why I don't bring up the bad stuff much, since 
it's a miniscule amount of what's generally reported on EVPs. 
Shamanically speaking, I'm very interested in Tulpas, so I'd love to 
hear your experience in greater depth.

A really wild turn of the screw recently happened after my group, 
DAPS, conducted an investigation at haunted house in Gainesville, 
Texas. The homeowner can't keep renters in it, so she's begun 
allowing paranormal investigators to come and check it out. We had 
quite a number of digital audio recorders running there, but what has 
us floored is the nature of what we picked up. 

The mindblowing aspects are as follows: First, that we got a huge 
number EVPs, more than any other location we've ever gone to before. 
And secondly, many of the EVPs, from various researcher's recorders 
have the unmistakable sounds of people having sex. Moans, groans, and 
cussing, with whips and screams included!

I am not kidding around or exagerating. Out of respect, I'll refrain 
from being explicit. Let me just say that if anyone wishes to verify 
the EVPs our investigator Jennifer captured, you're welcome to 
download the Gainesville house.zip of her wavs - 
http://www.filecrunch.com/file/%7Ecmkvx0

I'm still working on getting my EVPs onto the PC and uploaded, but 
they're part and parcel of the same carnal activities. After I aquire 
and synchronize myself with my MiniBox, I'm going back to see if 
anyone will give it a rest long enough to sing a few syllables... 
Yes, we recorded singing there as well.

I suppose the randy EVPs shouldn't be a surprise since the place was  
formerly a notoriously rumored Speak Easy during prohibition.

Does all this fall into the catagory of too much information?!

LOL!

Lance
